result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin D. Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other probation now serving.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 

Comply with all anger management and/or domestic violence counseling recommendations by your agent. 

141 days sentence credit, if revoked.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent. 

Maintain absolute sobriety.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent. 

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

You must submit to and successfully complete a mental health evaluation to determine appropriate programming commensurate with needs identified.  Must comply with all recommendations.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.
Defendant prohibited from possessing any firearms.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin D. Schultz

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM  Attorney Gregory J. Jerabek in court for Benjamin D. Schultz.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court.   22CF110 Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1. 22CF86 - Counts 2 & 3 defendant enters a plea of Guilty. 
Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm contrary to 948.03(2)(b), 2 Counts Bail Jumping-Felony contrary to 946.49(1)(b). Defendant exercised his right to allocution. 
22CF86 - Ct 1 DRI, remaining Counts DRI in 22CF54, 22CF62, 22CF66 and uncharged read ins. 

Joint recommendation: 5 yrs probation, maintain absolute sobriety, no bars, taverns liquor stores, no alcohol, AODA, random urinalysis testing, anger management counseling, complete mental health evaluation follow thru w/recommendations. Complete counseling and programming. 
Court adopts the joint recommendation: Withholds sentence, orders 5 years probation. Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol or bars, AODA and follow up, random testing, complete anger management and domestic abuse programming and counseling, complete a mental health evaluation, follow thru w/recommendations. Risk and needs assessment and follow through. CC. 141 days sentence credit. Firearm prohibition and voting ineligibility. 

22-05507 and 22-05531 Jackson county incident # DRI. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen today.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Babiak makes motion to modify bond to allow telephone contact with wife. State objects to lowering the cash bond and modifying to allow contact with wife.  Court denies the motion to modify bond.

1:28 PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court, in custody of JCJ.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak in court for Benjamin D. Schultz.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Both parties have received a copy of the report.  Both parties are in agreement with the report and not contesting.  Defendant is found competent to proceed.

1:28 PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court, in custody.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak in court for Benjamin D. Schultz.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for PTC 9/14 STC set for 10/3 @ 3pm.
Competency hearing on August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:29PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak in court for Benjamin D. Schultz. State is in victim rights compliance. State calls 1st witness, Officer JD: sworn, states occupation of a Deputy Sheriff. On duty on night of incident, testifies to incident, conversations with H. Argument occurred at 12:30 am. Testified to victim's descriptions of what happened between defendant and victims. Victim called 911. Testified to conversation with G. Spoke w/both parties on that evening. Record reflects identification of defendant. Cross examination. In respect to case 22CF54, State rests. State makes argument. Defense makes argument, asks court to dismiss Count 3. Court finds probable cause. 

 Competency hearing and arraignment 8/29 @ 1:30 PM.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Waive reading of the complaint.  Set for preliminary hearing.

4:13 PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz appeared by video, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak appeared by video for Benjamin D. Schultz. Atty Babiak states basis for bond modification motion. State objects to bond modification. Court denies bond modification. Set for preliminary hearing. Atty will contact JA to schedule.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 1:02 PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz appeared by video, in custody of JCJ.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak appeared by video for Benjamin D. Schultz. Counsel has now been established. Set for AIA on 7/27 at 3:30PM for all cases.  Atty Babiak can appear via zoom or in person.  Competency review hearing to be held during AIA.
Bail/bond hearing on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:23 PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant moves to dismiss 54, 62,66, 86. Court denies motion. Court has denied request to waive right to counsel again today. Bond Review Hearing set for 7/13 @ 1 pm.

3:19 PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. JA continuing to look for Atty. Court will not approve a request to represent himself based on mixing of terms, court does not believe defendant understands the proceedings. Defendant requesting preliminary hearings on each matters. State objects - need to wait for counsel. Court set for STC tomorrow 7/12 @ 1:00 pm. Defendant requesting signature bond. State objects to any change in the bond. Court denies defendant's bond motion. Bond remains.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:29 PM Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz appeared by video, in custody from Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. State is in victim rights compliance. Petition for appointment of counsel filed by defendant. Court has reviewed, will be appointing counsel. Evaluation confirmed for later this week by the WFU. Defendant instructed to cooperate w/WFU. STC date set for 7/11 @ 3 pm.
SPD non eligible
